oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quilting; Quilts; Sewing
Quilts; Quilting
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Close-up view of an area of a Butterfly quilt, showing details of the appliqued butterflies.

The word "quilt" is derived from the Latin word culcita, which means a stuffed sack, mattress, or cushion. A pieced butterfly is traditionally appliqued to a block, and the blocks are sewed together to form the quilt top. The Butterfly block pattern was a popular American design in the 1930s. The butterfly symbolized hope and new life during the Great Depression.
